metadata.synopsis: Struggling vaudeville comic Kip Cooper (Milton Berle) is tired of toiling in second-rate clubs for apathetic audiences, but he thinks he's got the ticket to Broadway stardom: stealing successful performers' material. When the famous Eddy Eagen (Bert Lahr) falls ill, Cooper seizes the opportunity to fill in for him. Luckily, he already knows Eagen's act, but his commitment to the show -- and to his pretty dance partner -- causes trouble between Cooper and his fiancée, Fay (Ruth Roman).

reviews: [Berle] remains on the screen for nearly two hours, pulling every stunt imaginable. Much of it is hilarious, but one becomes almost shell-shocked from the constant stream of gags.
A polished sentimental backstage biopic about making it to the top as a comic.
